Question Type: from effect to cause with intervention

causal_map_integration: High temperature can cause rain by increasing evaporation, while low temperature prevents rain by reducing evaporation. Setting the temperature below 10 degrees will stop rain because it is less likely to evaporate at such low temperatures.
